items.title: Post-Maduro 124% Rally Stuns Venezuela’s Battered Stock Exchange
items.summary: A stunning rally in Venezuelan assets after US forces removed president Nicolas Maduro from power has showcased how unprepared the local market is to absorb the new wave of attention.

items.title: Muni Restructuring Firm Formed by Ex-Citi Bankers Is Dissolving
items.summary: BGC Partners Advisory, a boutique restructuring firm started in 2024 by ex-Citigroup Inc. public finance bankers, is dissolving.

items.title: Tuning up the band: Music labels bet on movie companies to hit the high notes
items.summary: Saregama India and Universal Music are reshaping the entertainment industry by channeling funds into film production, indicating a robust strategy that transcends traditional production house dynamics. With the music industry facing challenges and intense competition for rights, these partnerships pave the way for consistent content generation while ensuring cost efficiency, ultimately enriching the creative pipeline of the labels.

items.title: Cardiac drugs log highest sales in 2025 as NCD cases surge
items.summary: Heart medicines led sales in 2025, a trend set to continue. Respiratory and anti-diabetes drugs followed. Cardiac drug sales grew 13%, with similar strong performance expected. Rising non-communicable diseases like hypertension fuel this growth. Increased awareness and longer treatment durations contribute.

items.title: CPSE Capex reached 74.5% of target by December, set to exceed annual target by fair margin
items.summary: The Capex for the month of December alone increased by 9.28% to Rs 70,000 crore, with many enterprises exceeding their annual budget target. The growth was led by the Railway board and National Highway Authority of India(NHAI) as they remained the highest spenders.

items.title: Credit costs rise for Shapoorji Pallonji Group firm as refinancing timeline slips
items.summary: The step-up was triggered after Goswami Infratech, a borrower linked to the structure, did not complete a refinancing by December end, said the people cited above. Although not a covenant breach, the delay requires existing borrowings to be repriced if fresh debt was raised at a higher cost.

items.title: Connectivity battle hits NMIA and Aqua Line
items.summary: Passengers face mobile network issues at Navi Mumbai International Airport and the Aqua Line metro. Telecom firms and airport and metro authorities are in a financial standoff over high connectivity charges. This dispute is affecting services for users of major mobile networks. A crucial meeting is scheduled to resolve the issue. Telcos are also renegotiating rates with other airports.

items.title: Rising competition hits sales growth of global beauty majors in India
items.summary: In India, renowned beauty titans L'Oreal and Estee Lauder are facing an unexpected dip in sales growth. As the beauty landscape becomes increasingly competitive, innovative newcomers are stepping in to capture the market. With the rise of online shopping, consumer purchasing habits are evolving, impacting brand loyalty and sales for established names.

items.title: Premium gain, margin strain likely for insurers in December quarter
items.summary: Most large life insurers, including LIC, HDFC Life, Axis Max and SBI Life, are set to post double-digit APE growth in Oct–Dec 2025, aided by GST tailwinds and a favourable base after new surrender value norms.

items.title: IndusInd Bank plans bigger board for better governance
items.summary: The bank is considering increasing its board strength to around a dozen members from the current nine with the aim of strengthening oversight and aligning with evolving regulatory expectations. Currently, managing director and CEO Rajiv Anand is the only executive on the board. Others are non-executive and independent directors.

items.title: HPE-Juniper Integration Allowed as Judge Reviews Settlement
items.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. can continue integrating Juniper Networks Inc. while a group of states challenge a settlement the companies reached with the Justice Department over antitrust concerns about the deal, a federal judge said Thursday.

items.title: Banks narrow NBFCs’ lead as India’s gold loan market turns nearly 50-50
items.summary: NBFCs' share of aggregate gold loans fell by nearly 20 percentage points over the past five years to 50.3% as of March 2025, from 69.4% in 2020. In the same period, banks increased their share to 49.7% from 30.6%, data showed.

items.title: Torrent Power bets Rs 1 lakh cr on energy, builds new B2C platforms: Jinal Mehta, vice-chairman and MD
items.summary: Torrent Power operates across the entire power value chain-coal-based and gas-based generation, renewables, transmission and distribution. We are also expanding into energy storage and green hydrogen. Importantly, every segment of the value chain is seeing growth today, giving us multiple growth engines and a balanced portfolio, says Jinal Mehta.

items.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
items.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers.  Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000.  The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially.  Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion.  This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

items.title: Brazils Equity Fund Managers Pin Hopes on Rate Cuts to Reverse Record Outflows

items.title: New tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
items.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

items.title: Budget may roll out ₹23,000 crore incentives to boost local capital goods manufacturing
items.summary: India may introduce incentive packages totaling up to ₹23,000 crore in the union budget for FY 2026-27 to boost domestic manufacturing of high-value capital goods. Schemes for construction equipment and automotive sectors are nearing finalization, aiming to reduce import reliance and strengthen global value chains.

items.title: PIB clears ₹26,000-crore Kamala Hydel Project in Arunachal
items.summary: In a momentous step forward, the Public Investment Board has greenlighted the ambitious 1,720 MW Kamala Hydroelectric Project, making a substantial investment of ₹26,000 crore. This advancement is set to enhance flood control and provide free energy to the residents of Arunachal Pradesh. Moreover, an additional ₹3,000 crore has been earmarked for establishing state-of-the-art power equipment testing facilities.

items.title: No road tax on factory, mine machinery: Supreme Court
items.summary: The Supreme Court has ruled that heavy industrial and construction machinery like dumpers and excavators, used within factories and mines, are not motor vehicles and thus exempt from road tax. This decision overturns a 2011 Gujarat High Court judgment, clarifying that vehicles designed for closed premises are outside the Motor Vehicles Act's purview.

items.summary: The Chief Economic Adviser has spotlighted key industries such as semiconductors, defence production, and critical industrial chemicals for self-sufficiency. Targeting a decrease in import reliance, this plan aspires to elevate India's economic influence internationally.

items.summary: The UN has upgraded India's economic growth projection to 6.6% for 2026, citing resilient private consumption and strong public investment. items.summary: PRAGATI, launched in 2015, has transformed how India tracks and delivers major infrastructure projects. In the power sector alone, 237 projects worth Rs 10.53 lakh crore have been reviewed and commissioned under its multi-layered monitoring system. By resolving over 90 per cent of identified issues - mostly related to land, clearances and right-of-way - PRAGATI has cut delays, reduced cost overruns and strengthened power availability. Global studies now see it as a benchmark for digital governance and coordinated execution.

This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
